comment: I really enjoyed professor Gregory's class discussions and lectures. However - the issues with technology and communication in the class were nightmarish. - issues with access to textbook & readings, issues with online communication, it's 2 days before the final and she has only graded a few of my assignments (from the whole semester).
rating_tags: Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: Dr. Gregory is a amazing professor. She imparts a lot of knowledge on her students and is extremely understanding and willing to change if students have issues with assignments. Her tests aren't easy, but this is one of the most worthwhile classes I have ever taken.

overall you will find this class very interesting. Missed about a week of class because of her health issues which wasn't her fault. you will read a lot. The class discussions are fun. If you don't participate in class or show up you will fail. h/e its the end of the semester and I only see my grade for one assignment.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--GRADED BY FEW THINGS--Amazing lectures

comment: The class is obviously a Race, Gender and Politics class, and I knew what I was getting myself into in this case, because that is how the class is essentially set up. However, the Professor teaching the course should be unbias, unfortunately that is not the case because she is completely one sided, and will call on other students who support her.

1st off PLEASE go to class you miss one day, you miss a life changing experience. There is so much you are able to learn in this class just by showing up and listening. You need your textbook for quizzes ebook works. She is the innovative professor of 2016!! OH btw TRUST THE PROCESS in this class it is totally worth it. TAKE HER NOW!!!
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Participation matters--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS

comment: She tried using an online program called Cengage that did not work for anyone until about a two months into the semester.  The problems I have experienced with her class are not her fault, and she has been great as far as listening to us and trying to help us. She is wishy-washy with due dates and that can be confusing, but just read her emails.

I've had a pretty good experience with Dr. Gregory so far. We meet once a week for an hour and fifteen minutes, complete a weekly quiz and deliver the class content on the online book. It's essentially a hybrid class. Im enjoying this class.

I took Mrs Gregory my last two semesters in college and I'll never regret it. Learning is a two step process. You must be willing, and be prepared to engage in it. Come to class prepared to ask questions, and to challenge. That's when you'll get the most out of it. Mrs. Gregory is more than willing to engage in conversational debate.

Took her in a joint class with Dr. Guillory and loved her. Come to class having read, and be prepared to Google terms that may be unfamiliar to you if you haven't taken a GWSTSociology class before. She really knows her stuff. The only class that I truly looked forward to this past spring.

By far the worst "educator" I have ever encountered in 16 years of schooling. Incompetent and unorganized, often disrupting students' routines with no apology or even explanation for her ridiculous decisions. If you like irritation, frustration, and having high blood pressure, she will suit you fine.

Dr. Gregory is at times like the absent minded professor. It's one of her quirks, and it's not necessarily a bad thing. If you're inflexible this is probably not the class for you. That said, she's not a bad instructor, and she cares about her students. There are lots of in class discussion, and plenty of opportunities to make an A.

most in class discussion, rarely any lectures. Besides the textbook you read two other books. Professor lacks knowledge of D2L so there will be some delays on things posted online. Syllabus will change throughout the course. Fairly easy course but expect to read and analyze a lot of the material on your own.

It might seem like a good idea to take this class because it's not that difficult but DON'T TAKE HER. You can tell she cares about the students but she is a horrible professor. She does not fully explain anything. She will just say she will post instructions online but then doesn't. She doesn't respond to e-mails and therefore, you get no clarity.

This professor is lazy and has no idea what she's doing. I'm currently taking this class and find it useless because we have had maybe 3 lectures all semester. She doesn't respond to emails, so if you need help or have questions don't bother asking. Sweet lady, but a terrible professor. I have learned NOTHING.

I'm in this class now and cannot believe that I haven't dropped. This class seems like a 'let's educate white people about black people' class. While we started off the class stating that urban does not equal black, all we do is talk about blacks and black issues. The conversationalist type of class setting we have is not conducive to learning.

I took a hybrid class which is half online, half in class. After 8 weeks of the semester, we had only met and had an actual class 4 times. She had posted only 2 weeks of lessons online by that time. Class was frequently canceled. It was a shame because she was a nice person. Just doesn't seem to know what she is doing with a hybrid class.

Wow.. Loved the course discussions.  The exams were challenging.  Syllabus kept changing (frustrating), but if you focus on the topics, the rest kind of worked itself out.  If you need someone to tell you what you are learning, this probably wouldn't be for you-- concepts are NOT spoon fed but are open for discussion.
Unorganized, biased, and woefully unprepared. I have no idea how this lady still has a job.

Dr. Gregory needs to find a different profession. She is incompetent and the whole class was confused the entire semester. She kept changing the syllabus, wouldn't respond to emails, and never posted anything online timely. A day before the midterm she finally posted a study guide. It is now a few days before the final and still no study guide.
She was still changing the syllabus at week 10. Not just one change at week 10, constant changes the entire semester. Need I say more?

If POLS4412 were a TV show, the synopsis would read something like this: "The simplest tasks turn into comedy hour as sweet-natured but totally ineffective Dr. Gregory navigates an endless series of pratfalls and problems." Unless you have a great sense of humor AND the patience of Job, she is not the professor for you.

Don't buy the textbook, we had no tests or quizzes in this class. Plenty of guest speakers, but just sign role and play on your phone--no need to pay attention. Basically just a bunch of stuff about how evil suburbs are, and a kiddie powerpoint project about a city. One of those college classes that's a waste of dollars and time.

I got a B in this class, and still don't know what we were supposed to learn, besides her personal views on issues. I also had no clue if I was getting an F or not when semester ended, she wouldn't return any of my five emails over the months. AVOID!

Dr Gregory brings something special to Kennesaw State.While some were dismayed in not sharing her viewpoints, the rest of us felt her views refreshing.Despite the fact that so many KSU students aren't mature enough to entertain anything beyond their parents ideology (even in college)Dr Gregory's presence challenged us to innovate.

This professor seemed more interested in her personal world view and study interests than with the subject matter she was supposed to teach. She did invite guest speakers to the class, however they had very little to do with the subject we were supposed to be learning. Overall this professor is a detriment to the quality of the education at KSU.

Extremely unorganized, cancels class often and is then unreachable for days when assignments are due and we don't understand. Assignments are given on very short notice, grades take months. It's late November and I don't have a clue what my overall grade is, nor what I was actually supposed to learn. My takeaway is how to format a bibliography. Wow
